Please put some effort into your challenge posts and research to see if it\'s already been done or is even a challenge to do! I don\'t know about anyone else but I\'m getting sick of pointless challenge posts spamming up this part of the forum. I\'m trying not to sound like a flamer here but it is difficult - it\'s nothing personal, just the lack of effort and general forum knowledge is irritating me.

Please put some effort into your challenge posts and research to see if it\'s already been done or is even a challenge to do! I don\'t know about anyone else but I\'m getting sick of pointless challenge posts spamming up this part of the forum. I\'m trying not to sound like a flamer here but it is difficult - it\'s nothing personal, just the lack of effort and general forum knowledge is irritating me.

I dunno. Nothing says challenges can only be done once, or only have to be aimed for the top 1% or whatever. There\'s plenty of room-- necessity, even!-- for relatively simple ones for new users.
Do any of the packs allowed even have powerful enough RCS\'s to do this?

Do any of the packs allowed even have powerful enough RCS\'s to do this?

The stock RCS units have a TWR > 1, placed appropriately, so yes, but I imagine you\'d run out of RCS juice pretty fast.

The stock RCS units have a TWR > 1, placed appropriately, so yes, but I imagine you\'d run out of RCS juice pretty fast.

Well it takes 16 stock RCS modules to lift one capsule and one RCS tank. You get about 45ish(?) seconds of flight time out of that. Not sure how this would scale up though.
C7 Flight pack has some directional thrusters pretty much designed for this; That\'s what Ryn used
Chute + pod + stock RCS tank+ 3x C7 forward RCS -> single stage to escape velocity.
